meanings.definition: A group of ships or boats traveling together.
meanings.sent1: The flotas of fishing boats sailed in unison across the calm sea.
meanings.sent2: The naval flotas assembled for a joint exercise in the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The flotas of rubber ducks in the bathtub made bath time a playful adventure.
meanings.sent4: The flotas of clouds drifted lazily in the sky, resembling a peaceful armada.
meanings.sent5: The flotas of colorful sailboats racing in the regatta painted a vibrant scene on the water.

meanings.definition: A fleet of vehicles or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The delivery company owned a flotas of trucks for transporting goods.
meanings.sent2: The airline's flotas of planes were ready for takeoff on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The flotas of bicycles parked outside the school created a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent4: The flotas of taxis zoomed through the city streets like a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent5: The flotas of hot air balloons ascending at dawn was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things moving together.
meanings.sent1: The flotas of students marched in unison during the school parade.
meanings.sent2: The flotas of ants worked together to carry food back to their nest.
meanings.sent3: The flotas of colorful balloons at the party added a festive touch to the event.
meanings.sent4: The flotas of leaves swirling in the wind created a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent5: The flotas of migrating birds filled the sky with a symphony of chirps.
